newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: PRESS DIGEST-Australian Sports News - May 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST-Australian Sports News - May 8.

text.p: (Compiled for Reuters by Media Monitors)
THE AUSTRALIAN

Soccer Australia has decided to hold the grand final of the national youth league northern division between Sydney United and Sydney Marconi at Parramatta Stadium, Sydney. The choice of venue will ensure more exposure for youth soccer in Australia. Page16.

Australian Nine television network confirmed yesterday it would broadcast one-day cricket internationals live during the Australian Cricket team's Ashes tour of the United Kingdom. Uncertainty still remains about the screening of Test series matches. Pae 16.

Australian basketball is currently embroiled in controversy following the fining of the Melbourne Tigers by National Basketball League tribunal officer Ken Madsen over the illegal playing of team member Mark Bradtke. The Tigers are set to lose NBL compettion points over the issue. Page 17.
THE SYDNEY MORNING HERALD

Australian world-cup triathlon champion Miles Stewart has been sidelined from international competition for several months due to knee surgery Stewart damaged his knee cartilage after an accident with dodgem racing cars at a charity function on the Gold Coast last month. Page 45.

A firm commitment has been made to Sunday horse racing events following a meeting of the Australian Jockey Club, Sydney Turf Club, the New South Wales Thoroughbred Racing Council and provincial racing clubs on the weekend. The financial viability of Sunday racing had been questioned due to the upcoming deregulation of the industry on July 1. Page 45.

Australian basketball player Annie La Fleur has been given the opportunity to represent Australia internationally following the withdrawal of injury stricken Australian Opals back-up joint guard, Michelle Chandler. La Fleur is expected to be named in the side playing against Olympic rivals Russia in a five-match series beginning next Tuesday. Page 45.
THE AGE

Current Australian Football League club the Sydney Swans have called for a reform of the AFL's administration and the appointment of a permanent senior executive in Sydney. The Swans want the new executive to have equal power to the AFL's general managerof football operations. Page B6.

The National Basketball League saw a surprise win last night, with the first ever victory of the Canberra Cannons over South-East Melbourne under Cannons coach Brett Flanigan. The Cannons won 89-78 in a close fought game. Page B6.

The Australian women's hockey team, the Hockeyroos, last night defeated New Zealand in the Telstra Challenge series 6-1, with co-captain Jenny Morris scoring three goals. The Australian team, consisting of 10 Olympic representatives, had 16 goal opportunties in the first half, compared with New Zealand's two. Page B6.
THE HERALD SUN

Australian Football League chief executive Wayne Jackson yesterday fuelled speculation of club relocations by giving his support to intra-state club sponsorships. He said economic pressure would in the future force clubs to examine a wide range of option. Page 94.

Prominent Australian Football League umpire John Harvey has been demoted to the reserve competition after recent involvement in controversial decisions and on-field disputes between players, including last week's sensational backdated video booking of Essndon's Dean Wallis. Page 94.

Australian Football League team Carlton and its marketable player Anthony Koutoufides are headed for a legal tangle over Koutoufides' sponsorship of brand football boots. The dispute flared when Carlton announced it was switching its association from adidas to rival Nike, yet Koutoufides is locked into a three-year personal endorsement contract with adidas. Page 96.
THE DAILY TELEGRAPH

Australian boxer Kostya Tszyu will head to Atlantic City on June 1 to defend his IBF junior welter-weight title against American Vince Phillips. Pay-TV channel Optus Vision has exclusive rights to the event. Page 85.

Australian marathon swimmer Susie Maroney has suffered a setback in her latest attempt to swim from Cuba to the United States with the deportation from Cuba of her boat captain Luis Alcalde, who was born in Cuba. Alcalde, now a US citizen, was deported bcause of a legal regulation that prevents ex-citizens of Cuba arriving on the island by boat. Page 85.

Australian paralympic silver medallist, amputee athlete Neil Fuller, will compete in the Challenge of Champions athletics competition in Canada on June 1. Fuller will be competing in the only disabled event on the program, the 100 metres sprint. Page 88
